data.title: Awesome Food
data.text: Love this restaurant.  The food is always great and portions are big!  Never leave unhappy.  Highly recommend!

data.title: Are you kidding me?
data.text: This place is fantastic!   The menu itself is amazing.  I had a very tough time choosing.   The Parmesan scallops were so good!  But the chef's special gnocchi was to die for!   Perfection in a bowlour service was fantastic!  They gave us many reasons to come back!  Excellent food, excellent service, excellent atmosphere!!!

data.title: Italian deliciousness!
data.text: One of the best Italian restaurants around. The Italian nachos are a wonderful appetizer. The fettuccine alfredo is fabulous and so is everything else I've eaten there.

data.title: Good Food - Nice Atmoshere
data.text: Food is very good and it's a great place for lunch with friends or a working lunch.  Great place for date night dinner!

data.title: Excellent Food - Great atmosphere
data.text: I love going to the Pasta Grill.  You can always count on excellent food and service. This place is very popular with the locals.  It's located in an old refurbished downtown building and a lot of the building character has been left in place.   Can be a little busy in the evenings, I was there last week on a Thursday evening about 6:30pm and had to wait for about 15 minutes for a table.  But it's definitely worth the wait!  Portions are large, I usually end up taking some home with me and enjoying it the next day.

data.title: Pasta Grill in Conway, AR
data.text: Food and service was great! Seating is a little cramped and I don't remember any table that would accord ate over 4 people (but I may have missed some larger group eating arrangements.  The food is delicious!!

data.title: Where the Locals Go for DATE NIGHT!
data.text:
If you ask most of the locals where they'd like to go for a nice evening out, they'll probably say Pasta Grill.  It's a nice little restaurant downtown.  If you go on a Friday or Saturday night, you'll have a little wait, but it IS WORTH IT.  My favorite dish is the Blackened Shrimp Scampi Pasta.  If you loved the scampi a la Romano at Macaroni Grill in the 90s, you'll think you've died and gone to scampi heaven, I promise!  I have tried to find this same scampi flavor at a gazillion restaurants over the years, and this is it.  

So, take a little trip to downtown Conway, AR.  You will enjoy the Toadsuck Square atmosphere.  I know you'll love Pasta Grill.

data.title: Consistent
data.text: Generous serving\s, good service and always consistent. Parking is available on street. A little busy on weekends

data.title: Favorite Restaurant in Conway
data.text: I have never been a fan of most pasta restraunts but this one is unique! The food is always tasty and portions plentiful. The atmosphere is dark and romantic. A great place for date night!

data.title: A++
data.text: This restaurant has been in Conway for a while, and I'm sad that this is the first time we have ever been there!  We will definitely be going back.  They had a diverse menu with everything from traditional Italian like Lasagna and Chicken Parm to more creative options like gnocchi and the dish that I had that was new potatoes with vegetables, sausage, and chicken.  Everything, including the breaded Ravioli appetizer, was delicious.  I think the entrees that we had were between $12-$16.  The wait staff was also very attentive and did a great job.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: The burgers and fries are delicious! Burgers are always fresh and made when you order never ahead of time!

data.title: Date with hubby.
data.text: The service is always top notch as is the food. The prime rib is always amazing. Love their Caesar salad. Nice wine selection.

data.title: Good food but terrible check in process.
data.text: We have previously eaten at the pasta grill in Searcy and since it closed we thought we would try the Conway one. We waited over an hour for a table. Apparently if you call ahead you are given priority over those waiting at the restaurant even if you have been waiting longer, actually twice as long. Still we like the food just very frustrating service.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: This is a wonderful little local restaurant. They have some of the best Italian food I've had. Always fresh and consistently good. I've eaten here many times and never ordered something I didn't like. The bread that comes with the food is great. I love the pasta grill!

data.title: Yummy food
data.text: A lovely restaurant in the old part of downtown. We had to wait a few minutes for a table but not bad for a Thursday night. The food was very plentiful & tasty. My husband loved their meatballs & ravioli.  I had the Alfredo & it was good. Yummy warm bread. Desserts looked good but we couldn't finish our dinner so no chance for dessert.

data.title: First visit
data.text: Got there early, just as they opened   (tip from a friend ). It was awesome.  Order the cannoli for dessert!

data.title: Awesome Food!
data.text: The service is great and the garlic bread is amazing. Make sure to share or you'll need to go boxes. It's a little pricey but if you don't mind unzipping your wallet it's a perfect place for you.

data.title: Steak in Conway??
data.text:
Conway is not known as a culinary destination.  But we were in town and saw that the reviews were good.  Ok, I'll bite.  Got there as it opened.  Within 20 min it was packed.  Cool place.  Liked the vibe. Started with cheese garlic bread.  Heavy on the cheese, a bit too heavy but good and served with a side of sweet tasty marinara.  
For entrees my wife had the spaghetti. It was "ok".  But I'm a steak guy.  Eat 2-3 a month.  So for my 57 years, I've been eating steaks for let's say 37 years.  So I've eaten somewhere around 1300 ribeyes and strips.  Tonight I ordered the ribeye.  Medium.  It came looking good.  I told wife if it tastes as good as it looks....and it didn't.  It was BETTER.   Perfect cut. Marbled but not fatty.  Perfectly cooked.  BEST STEAK IVE EVER EATEN.  In an Italian place in Conway AR.  Better than Sonny Williams, Riverfront or Arthur's, the three top houses in the state.  

Great job Pasta Grill!

data.title: Favorite Restaurant in Conway
data.text: My husband and I have lived in Conway for three years. We have eaten almost everywhere. Pasta Grill is by far the best Italian food I have ever had. It is a small restaurant, and they have narrow lunch hours, 11-2, so you have to know when they're open. They are open for dinner starting at 5pm. My favorite dish is chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. My husband likes the jambalaya pasta and the grilled pasta. Always ask for extra bread. You will never get enough.

data.title: Great food at a great price.
data.text: There is usually a little wait, but it is always worth it. Some of the best Italian food I've found.
